intro: Aconitum degenii nothosubsp. lippertianum, commonly known as the Lippert's monkshood, is a hybrid plant native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple hooded flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive basal arrangement and is known for its toxic alkaloids. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in some regions.
